subject: Re: Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
msgSnippet: ... In my experience, in case of (for example) a NullPointerException, tearDown() is not (always) called (junit 3.8.1, no extensions). But it might be that the
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
> A question: why not do that clean up in tearDown()?

In my experience, in case of (for example) a NullPointerException,
tearDown() is not (always) called (junit 3.8.1, no extensions).
But it might be that the tearDown() was just not called when
something went wrong in setUp(), which is easy remedied by putting a
try-catch in the setup code, the catch calling tearDown, or
performing clean-up actions.

With regards,

Martijn Dashorst
